fact_check_explanation_title: Reopening universities will almost certainly not cause 50,000 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: This assumes that every student in the UK catches Covid-19 this autumn, and that nothing is done to stop it

fact_check_explanation_title: This is not an image of a naked child “escaping” from Buckingham Palace
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was a viral hoax for a TV show.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence the number of people taking their own life fell during the Covid-19 pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health secretary Matt Hancock was wrong to say figures for England show a decrease in the number of people taking their own life.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figures for people seeking asylum in hotels and veterans sleeping rough are both wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s not true that 48,000 “illegals” are housed in hotels, and estimates of 6,000 veterans sleeping rough are likely to be too high.

fact_check_explanation_title: A graph spreading on Facebook gets it wrong on flu vs Covid deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Flu is not the underlying cause of deaths in more people than Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims of pandemic fall in child anxiety may not apply across the whole country
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study which found that students’ anxiety levels were lower during the pandemic than in October 2019 was conducted among year 9 students in the south west of England.

fact_check_explanation_title: Children in Need is not donating £10 million to Black Lives Matter
fact_check_explanation_summary: The BBC charity is matching Stormzy’s £10m pledge to causes tackling racial inequality in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about Covid-19 transmission in schools?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The evidence is limited as fewer children have attended school during the pandemic, but broadly suggests that while there is some risk, schools aren’t likely to play a large role …

fact_check_explanation_title: A retracted paper linking 5G and coronavirus with no evidence is doing the rounds on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper, which was retracted days after it was published, did not prove any link between 5G and coronaviruses.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ukrainian soldiers have not died after having an American Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Six members of the Ukrainian military have died of Covid-19 so far, but that wasn’t anything to do with a vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Comparing tax dodging and benefits for people seeking asylum
fact_check_explanation_summary: MP Zarah Sultana claimed that the super-rich and large corporations dodge £90 billion in tax every year. This is based on an estimate for the tax gap which is much …

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock misstates the proportion of Test and Trace contacts being reached
fact_check_explanation_summary: Matt Hancock misspoke saying that 79.7% of close contacts of infected people are being reached by test and trace.
